title: Week 26 to 30
poses: Siddhasana or Padmasana (Ujjayi w/ Antar Kumbhaka)

title: Short Course, Day 1
poses: Substitute: Asana #297 Bharadvajasana I if twist difficult

title: Short Course, Day 2
poses: Triang Mukha Eka Pada Paschimottanasana (Right & Left)
Ujjayi or Nadi Sodhana Pranayama (8 min)

title: Short Course, Day 3
poses: Without Kumbhaka or retention of breath

title: Weeks 40 - 44: Course 2 Consolidation (New Poses Only)
poses: Lower legs to 90 degrees while in Sirsasana.
Twist the trunk and legs to the side in Headstand.
Twist and split the legs in Headstand.
Lower one leg to the floor while in Headstand.
Lower one leg sideways to the floor in Headstand.
Shoulderstand with palms on the floor, no back support.
Arms extended by the sides of the legs.
Move both feet to the extreme right, then left in Plow pose.
Lower one leg sideways toward the floor in Shoulderstand.
Drop back from Sarvangasana into Bridge pose.
Bridge pose from Sarvangasana with one leg raised.
Horse Pose - requires high knee and hip flexibility.
Couch pose - extension of Supta Virasana.
Bound forward bend with one leg in half-lotus.
Both Big Toes pose - balancing on the sitting bones.
Upward Facing Intense Stretch - balancing on sitting bones.
Variation balancing with legs wider or closer to torso.
Seated twist with one leg in Virasana, one in Lotus.
Intense leg stretch on back - preparatory for backbends.
The Wheel pose - repeat up to 6 times.

title: Week 55 to 60
poses: Dhyana (in Siddhasana, Virasana, Baddha Konasana or Padmasana)

title: Week 74-78: Master Review I (Foundations)
poses: All major standing poses from Courses 1 & 2 (Trikonasana through Utthita Hasta Padangusthasana).
Focus on lateral and wide-legged forward extensions.
Key standing and kneeling poses from Course 2.
Ardha Baddha Padma and Triang Mukha variations.
Krounchasana, Marichyasana I, and Upavistha Konasana.
The primary forward bend and its revolved variation.
Lotus pose and its Course 2 variations (Garbha Pindasana, Yoga Mudrasana).

title: Week 74-78: Master Review II (Advanced)
poses: Salamba Sirsasana I and Urdhva Dandasana.
Plow pose and all its lateral and one-legged variations.
Review of balances: Astavakrasana, Bhujapidasana, Mayurasana, and Bakasana.
Intense hip openers and leg-behind-head preparations.
Marichyasana III, Ardha Matsyendrasana I, and Pasasana.
Salabhasana and Dhanurasana leading to Urdhva Dhanurasana (Wheel).
Prepare the body for Pranayama and meditation.

title: Weekly Practice  Day 4
poses: Urdhva Dhanurasana (486)  12 times (20 sec each time)
Nadi Shodhana Pranayama (Section 205 / Plate 600)  15 min (with inhalation retention)

title: Weekly Practice  Day 6
poses: Urdhva Dhanurasana (486)  6 times (2030 sec each time)

title: Weeks 79 - 84
poses: Sit in Siddhasana (84), Virasana (89), Padmasana (104), or Baddha Konasana (102).

title: Weeks 85 - 90
poses: Siddhasana, Virasana, Padmasana, or Baddha Konasana.

title: Weeks 95 - 100
poses: Repeat 8 times. Stretch limbs (487) after each to relieve back stiffness.

title: Weeks 101 - 108
poses: Drop from Sirsasana (184) to Viparita Dandasana (516) and swing back to Sirsasana. Concentrate on this transition. Shorten subsequent asanas if needed.
Repeat 8 times. Stretch limbs (487) to relieve stiffness.

title: Weeks 109 - 125
poses: Drop from Sirsasana (184) to Viparita Dandasana (516) and swing back to Sirsasana. Focus on control and perseverance.
Repeat 8 times. Counter-stretch with 487 between reps.
Practice 15 times daily at a stretch. This is the back flip/kick-over from Urdhva Dhanurasana.

title: Weeks 126 - 130
poses: Lower from Sirsasana II (192) into Bakasana (410).
Dwi Pada Viparita Dandasana from Sirsasana
Drop from Sirsasana (184) into Dwi Pada Viparita Dandasana (516).
In a seated posture of choice.

title: Weeks 131 - 136
poses: If exhausted by backbends, do this cycle on alternate days. Use full variations 184-218.
Strenuous kick-over. Practice 15 times daily at a stretch to perfect back-bending.
Focus on opening the chest and shoulders.
Excluding 267. Practice on alternate days if back-bending intensity is too high.
If Viparita Chakrasana is too strenuous, do Pranayama on alternate days only.

title: Weeks 137 - 142
poses: Lower from Sirsasana II (192) into Bakasana (410).
Dwi Pada Viparita Dandasana from Sirsasana
Drop from Sirsasana I (184) to Dwi Pada Viparita Dandasana (516) and back to Sirsasana. Repeat 3 times.
Walking around in a circle while in Headstand (Plates 525-535).
In a seated posture of choice.

title: Weeks 143 - 145
poses: Lower from Sirsasana II into Bakasana.
Leg behind head, arms behind back, leaning forward.
Dwi Pada Viparita Dandasana from Sirsasana
Drop from Sirsasana I to Dwi Pada Viparita Dandasana and back. Repeat 3 times.
Walking in a circle in Headstand.
Incorporate different methods from Part Three (Ujjayi, Surya Bhedana, Nadi Sodhana). Morning Pranayama is recommended.
Instruction: Do early morning Pranayama; difficult asanas in the morning; Sirsasana/Sarvangasana cycles in the evening. Alternatively, Pranayama in the morning and asanas in the evening.

title: Weeks 146 - 155
poses: Finishing the previous arm balances with the kick-over.
Walking in a circle in Headstand.
Plate 512 refers to Laghu Vajrasana/Advanced Kapotasana stages.
Ujjayi, Suryabhedana, or Nadi Sodhana with internal breath retention.

title: Weeks 159 - 160 (Master Review II)
poses: Nadi Sodhana or as per current practice.

title: Week 181-2: Daily Course (Day 2)
poses: Move through Padmasana and its variations (Plates 104-124).

title: Weekly Practice  Day 1
poses: Ekapada Bakasana II with Ekapada Koundinyasana II (451 with 442)
